testimonial1.name: Sarah Johnson
testimonial1.quote: This program transformed my approach to business and gave me the confidence to launch my startup. The mentorship and resources provided were invaluable.

testimonial2.name: Michael Chen
testimonial2.quote: The mentorship I received was invaluable. My mentor helped me navigate challenges I never expected and provided insights that shaped my business strategy.

testimonial3.name: Emma Rodriguez
testimonial3.quote: The community and networking opportunities through this program opened doors I never thought possible. The connections I made were just as valuable as the mentorship.

testimonial4.name: David Kim
testimonial4.quote: The practical workshops and hands-on learning experiences were exactly what I needed to take my business to the next level. Highly recommended!

timeline.title: Business Case Training Sessions

event1.title: Session 1: Entrepreneurial Mindset & Founder Spirit
event1.description: Students explore the mindset of successful founders by discovering their personal target (WHY) using the Golden Circle (WHY–HOW–WHAT). They learn the value of Grit, Curiosity, Vision, and reflect through activities like Ikigai Canvas and Founder Bingo. The session ends with each student creating their personal 1-page Founder’s Manifesto and setting 12-month goals.

event2.title: Session 2: The American Business Mindset
event2.description: This session focuses on structured startup thinking—identifying real-world problems and validating solutions. Students learn TAM–SAM–SOM market sizing using Excel and analyze the success story of Airbnb. Each group estimates market size for their own idea and writes a 150-word Problem Statement.

event3.title: Session 3: Design Thinking & User Insights
event3.description: Using the 5-step Design Thinking process, students learn how to discover user pain points and turn them into actionable insights. Through techniques like 5 Whys and Shadowing, students conduct 1–1 interviews and map insights visually using Empathy Maps and Affinity Mapping.

event4.title: Session 4: Market Analysis & Target Customers
event4.description: Students build customer personas using demographics, psychographics, and JTBD. They map customer journeys and analyze competition using Porter’s 5 Forces and SWOT. Each group creates a competitive matrix comparing their startup with three real competitors.

event5.title: Session 5: Business Models & Lean Canvas
event5.description: Students complete their Lean Canvas and explore monetization strategies like subscriptions, ads, and freemium. Using the MVP Ladder, they define must-have vs. nice-to-have features and stress-test their ideas in a 360° peer review exercise called 'Kill Your Idea'.

event6.title: Session 6: MVP Building & Product Strategy
event6.description: Groups select an MVP type (Wizard-of-Oz, Concierge, Landing Page) and design wireframes using Figma. Students define a key success KPI (e.g., Activation Rate) and prepare to test their MVPs with at least 5 real users using checklists.

event7.title: Session 7: Teamwork & Agile Fundamentals
event7.description: Shifting from individual to team-based projects, students adopt Agile practices using Scrum. They define team roles via the RACI Matrix, set quarterly OKRs, and participate in the Marshmallow Challenge. Each group builds a Sprint-0 Backlog with 15+ user stories.

event8.title: Session 8: Marketing Fundamentals & Growth Hacking
event8.description: Students explore the AARRR funnel—from acquisition to revenue—and create social content based on Growth Loops. They analyze Duolingo’s viral TikTok strategy and design 3 mock posts for their startup using Canva.

event9.title: Session 9: Financial Forecasting & Fundraising Basics
event9.description: Students calculate startup metrics like CAC, LTV, and Break-even. Each team builds a 3-year P&L financial model and role-plays a mock pitch in Shark Tank format, gaining practical knowledge of early-stage fundraising.

event10.title: Session 10: Pitch Deck & Storytelling
event10.description: Students create a 10-slide pitch deck using the Guy Kawasaki framework. They practice delivering 60-second elevator pitches, review one another’s presentations, and refine their stories using feedback from mentors and peers.

event11.title: Session 11: Project Sprint & User Testing
event11.description: Teams run a real user testing sprint, gather feedback from at least 10 users, and measure activation, NPS, and churn. Students then decide whether to pivot or persevere based on feedback and sprint metrics.

event12.title: Session 12: 1-on-1 Mentor Coaching
event12.description: Each team receives personalized coaching from mentors to refine their pitch deck, financials, demo video, and traction in preparation for international competitions like JA or DECA. Students leave with a clear action plan for final submission.

event13.title: Session 13: Mock Competition & Q&A
event13.description: Students pitch live in a simulated competition, followed by a tough Q&A round. They learn to handle questions with confidence using bridging techniques, refine body language, and score themselves using judge rubrics.

event14.title: Session 14: Startup Ecosystem & Networking
event14.description: Students explore the startup ecosystem map (Vietnam & US), practice cold-emailing mentors/VCs, and build networking skills. The session features a live panel with alumni founders and VC analysts to expand students’ networks.

event15.title: Session 15: Reflection & University Pathway
event15.description: The journey ends with portfolio building, career vision planning, and a personalized university roadmap. Students write a letter to their 'Future Me', create a vision board, and map out a 4-year SMART plan across leadership, academics, and startup goals.

timeline.joinProgramDescription: Take your business case skills to the next level with our expert-led training sessions

project1.title: Improving the School Canteen Sales System
project1.description: The team analyzed the current operations of the school canteen and proposed a digital payment solution to reduce wait times and improve the student experience.

project2.title: Friendly Study Reminder App
project2.description: In a 48-hour hackathon, the team designed a prototype of an app that lets students set study reminders and notes through a simple, user-friendly interface.

project3.title: Used Textbook Sharing Platform
project3.description: The team pitched a nonprofit startup model that enables students to exchange or donate used textbooks via a simple online platform.

project4.title: Optimizing Club Activity Planning
project4.description: This project used survey data analysis to help student clubs create more engaging plans and improve overall participation rates.

services.title: Our Services
services.description: We offer a range of services to help you achieve your goals.

service1.title: Startup Sprint Program
service1.description: Work in teams to develop an original startup idea, guided by mentors and real business tools.

service2.title: Business Case Bootcamp
service2.description: Train like a real consultant with case-solving challenges from real-world companies and industries.

service3.title: 1-on-1 Mentorship
service3.description: Get personalized guidance from experienced mentors to explore your strengths and goals.

service4.title: Startup Showcase & Certification
service4.description: Present your project at the final showcase and earn a certificate for completing the full Youngpreneur journey.

question1.label: Who can join the Youngpreneur Academy program?
question1.answer: High school students in grades 10 to 12 across Vietnam, especially those interested in business, creativity, and teamwork.

question2.label: How long is the program and what is the learning format?
question2.answer: The program consists of 15 sessions held weekly. The format includes in-person learning combined with team activities, presentations, and real-world project work.

question3.label: What will students gain after completing the program?
question3.answer: Students will develop business thinking, teamwork skills, presentation techniques, market analysis, product development, and basic fundraising abilities.

question4.label: Do students need any prior knowledge to join?
question4.answer: No. The program is designed for beginners who have no prior experience but are eager to learn and grow.

question5.label: Do students have to submit a final project?
question5.answer: Yes. Each team will present a real project during the final session in a mock startup competition format.
